jsx
Class Task

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Task
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Interval, Timeout
public abstract class Task
extends Disposable
implements java.lang.Runnable

An abstract base class for runnable tasks.

As a runnable object, a runnable task can be run by a call to its run() method. In addition, you can get its function version with a simple call to its getFunction() method.

To make a task concretely runnable, a subclass of this one must decide to either override the run() method, and in its constructor, with a call to the getFunction() method, set the funct field to a function running the run() method , or set the funct field directly in its constructor to an existed function and run the funct function in the method overriding the run() method of this class.

A subclass of this class must follow the above rule to make sure that its function version and method run() are both running the same execution code.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
See Also:
TaskManager

Field Detail

funct

protected JsFunction<java.lang.Void> funct

The function version of this runnable task.

If a subclass sets this field to a desired existing function in its constructor, it must override the run() method and run this function in that method. On the contrary, if a subclass chooses to override the run() method to provide the task functionality, then it must, in its constructor, set this field to a function returned by calling the getFunction() method.

Since:
1.0
Constructor Detail

Task

protected Task()

The default constructor.

This constructor does not set the funct field. A call to the getFunction() method will set it up anyway. A subclass, in its need, may choose to set the funct field in any of its constructors including the default one.

Since:
1.0
Method Detail

run

public abstract void run()

Runs the runnable task.

If a subclass chooses to override this method to provide the task functionality, then it must, in its constructor, set the funct field to a function returned by calling the getFunction() method. On the contrary, if a subclass sets the getFunction() field to a desired existing function in its constructor, then it must override this method and run that function in the overriding method.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Since:
1.0

getFunction

public final JsFunction<java.lang.Void> getFunction()

Gets the function version of this runnable task.

This method returns the function if it already exists. Otherwise, it creates one that simply runs the run() method.

Returns:
The function for the current runnable task if it exists. Otherwise the method creates one and returns it.
Since:
1.0

makeFunction

public static final JsFunction<java.lang.Void> makeFunction(java.lang.Runnable r)

A utility to create a function from a runnable object.

The function simply runs the Runnable.run() method of the runnable object and returns nothing (null for undefined).

Parameters:
r - A runnable object.
Returns:
The function for the runnable object.
Since:
1.0
